references.paper_title: Highly accurate protein structure prediction with AlphaFold
references.reason: This paper introduces AlphaFold2, a revolutionary deep learning model that achieved unprecedented accuracy in protein structure prediction, significantly impacting the field and serving as a cornerstone for many subsequent studies.

references.paper_title: Accurate prediction of protein structures and interactions using a three-track neural network
references.reason: This paper presents RoseTTAFold, another highly accurate protein structure prediction model that utilizes a three-track neural network approach, providing an alternative and competitive method to AlphaFold2.

references.paper_title: Biological structure and function emerge from scaling unsupervised learning to 250 million protein sequences
references.reason: This paper demonstrates the power of scaling unsupervised learning techniques on protein sequences, significantly contributing to the advancement of protein language models and structure prediction.
This paper introduces the MSA Transformer, a model that effectively utilizes multiple sequence alignments (MSAs) to enhance protein structure prediction, addressing a key challenge in the field.

references.paper_title: Gapped blast and psi-blast: a new generation of protein database search programs
references.reason: This paper introduces BLAST, a fundamental algorithm for comparing biological sequences that has been extensively used in protein structure prediction and related fields for decades.
